Questions.Question: Which designer is known for the Little Black Dress?
Questions.Explanation: Coco Chanel popularized the Little Black Dress in the 1920s, creating a timeless fashion staple for women.

Questions.Question: Who is known as the Queen of Prints?
Questions.Explanation: Diane von Furstenberg gained fame for her bold prints and iconic wrap dresses, earning the title 'Queen of Prints'.

Questions.Question: Which designer is associated with the Red-Soled Shoes?
Questions.Explanation: Christian Louboutin is renowned for his signature red-lacquered soles, symbolizing glamour and luxury in footwear fashion.

Questions.Question: Who popularized the Minimalist Fashion Movement?
Questions.Explanation: Calvin Klein's clean lines and minimalist designs defined the fashion movement in the late 20th century, influencing global fashion trends.

Questions.Question: Which designer introduced the Wrap Dress?
Questions.Explanation: Diane von Furstenberg designed the iconic wrap dress in the 1970s, revolutionizing women's fashion with its flattering silhouette.

Questions.Question: Who is the founder of the luxury brand Gucci?
Questions.Explanation: Guccio Gucci founded the House of Gucci in 1921, creating a legacy of high-end leather goods and iconic fashion.

Questions.Question: Which designer is known for the Tuxedo Jacket for Women?
Questions.Explanation: Yves Saint Laurent pioneered the androgynous tuxedo jacket for women, revolutionizing power dressing in the fashion industry.

Questions.Question: Who is regarded as the King of Cling for his body-conscious designs?
Questions.Explanation: Azzedine Alaïa was acclaimed for his form-fitting, body-conscious silhouettes, earning him the title 'King of Cling' in fashion.

Questions.Question: Which designer is known for the Punk Fashion Movement?
Questions.Explanation: Vivienne Westwood, the godmother of punk fashion, shaped the movement with her daring designs and rebellious spirit.

Questions.Question: Who is renowned for the concept of Urban Streetwear?
Questions.Explanation: Virgil Abloh brought urban streetwear to high fashion through his brand Off-White, redefining luxury and contemporary style.

Questions.Question: Who is credited for introducing the Shoulder Pad Trend?
Questions.Explanation: Thierry Mugler revolutionized 1980s fashion with exaggerated shoulder pads, defining power dressing and futuristic silhouettes.

Questions.Question: Which designer is known for the iconic Kate Moss Slip Dress?
Questions.Explanation: John Galliano's slip dress worn by Kate Moss in the 1990s became an iconic fashion moment, epitomizing effortless chic.

Questions.Question: Who is recognized for popularizing the Bohemian-Chic Style?
Questions.Explanation: Isabel Marant's laid-back, bohemian-chic aesthetic became a global fashion phenomenon, inspiring effortless and free-spirited style.

Questions.Question: Which designer is associated with the Trench Coat and Heritage Check?
Questions.Explanation: Burberry's iconic trench coat and trademark check pattern represent timeless British fashion heritage, synonymous with luxury and sophistication.

Questions.Question: Who revolutionized the Fashion World with the Mini Skirt?
Questions.Explanation: Mary Quant's daring mini skirt design in the 1960s sparked a fashion revolution, symbolizing youth culture and liberation.

Questions.Question: Which designer is known for the concept of Unisex Fashion?
Questions.Explanation: Rad Hourani challenged traditional gender norms with unisex fashion, creating a gender-neutral aesthetic that redefines modern elegance.

Questions.Question: Who popularized the concept of Avant-Garde Fashion in the 1980s?
Questions.Explanation: Comme des Garçons, led by designer Rei Kawakubo, pushed boundaries with avant-garde fashion, redefining beauty and aesthetics in the industry.

Questions.Question: Which designer is known for the creation of the Punk Rock Fashion movement?
Questions.Explanation: Vivienne Westwood's collaboration with Malcolm McLaren sparked the punk rock fashion movement, challenging conventions and inspiring social rebellion.

Questions.Question: Who introduced the concept of Sustainable Fashion through the brand Stella McCartney?
Questions.Explanation: Stella McCartney spearheaded sustainable and ethical fashion practices, advocating for cruelty-free and environmentally conscious luxury fashion.

Questions.Question: Which designer is renowned for the creation of the Power Suit for Women?
Questions.Explanation: Giorgio Armani redefined professional attire for women with his iconic power suits, empowering them with elegance and confidence in the workplace.
